definition: to have a clear conscience/to have no qualms about sth
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere
surname An
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

sentences.english: It was many years before Skywalker felt comfortable enough to take on students.
sentences.chinese: 很多年以後，天行者才心安理得地開始收徒。

sentences.english: Make the decision that is right for the largest number of people.
sentences.chinese: 要做對儘可能多的人心安理得的決定。

sentences.english: Mrs. Butler was sitting in rotund complacency at the foot of the table.
sentences.chinese: 巴特勒太太心安理得地坐在桌子的末端。

sentences.english: When in school, they spend their parnets'money without any execuse.
sentences.chinese: 上學時心安理得地花着家裏的錢。

sentences.english: Don't take water or “Elixir” for granted.
sentences.chinese: 不要將水或“聖泉”視爲心安理得之物。

sentences.english: Mr Aboutaam also says the statue was bought in good faith.
sentences.chinese: 雅博達姆也表示，他當時買下這尊雕塑時也心安理得。

sentences.english: If you want to be at peace with yourself, return the stolen money to the store.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想心安理得那就把偷來的前還回店家。

sentences.english: "That was just something for evening wear, " returned his wife complacently.
sentences.chinese: “那套衣服是晚裝，”他妻子心安理得地說道。

sentences.english: Xiong Jiujiu to walk, and with a clear conscience go play.
sentences.chinese: 雄糾糾地走了，心安理得地玩樂去了。

definition: delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
in the right and self-confident (idiom); bold and confident with justice on one's side/to have the courage of one's convictions/just and forceful
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
to reap where one has not sown (idiom)
variant of 花招[hua1 zhao1]
to have no sense of shame
perfectly contented (idiom)/perfectly satisfied
calm/undisturbed
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
free and at leisure (idiom); unfettered/outside the reach of the law (of criminal)/at large
willingly and gladly (idiom)
lit. as sweet as syrup (idiom, from Book of Songs); to endure hardship gladly/a glutton for punishment
confident/calm/natural/poised
lit. heaven's law and earth's principle (idiom); fig. right and proper/right and unalterable/a matter of course
to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
just and honorable
